match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 6 wickets (with 10 balls remaining)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of England and Scotland
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of England and Scotland

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook run out (†Sangakkara) 119 (143b 13x4 0x6 208m) SR: 83.21

dismissalComment.html: Cook falls trying to steal a bye. Sangakkara hit the stumps with his under-arm flick and it ends a very important innings for Cook. He gets a standing ovation and rightly so, he may not have been swift but England's other batsmen didn't allow him to be

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: BMAJ Mendis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: BMAJ Mendis headshot

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kevin Pietersen c Randiv b Mendis 41 (43b 6x4 0x6 45m) SR: 95.34

dismissalComment.html: Mendis does for Pietersen again! Great work from him this over. Googly here that Pietersen tries to sweep, the extra bounce finds a top edge that loops all the way to deep midwicket. Ends such a promising innings but the spinners have heaped pressure on England

headshotImage.caption: BMAJ Mendis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: BMAJ Mendis headshot

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mendis does for Pietersen again! Great work from him this over. Googly here that Pietersen tries to sweep, the extra bounce finds a top edge that loops all the way to deep midwicket. Ends such a promising innings but the spinners have heaped pressure on England

headshotImage.caption: EJG Morgan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: EJG Morgan headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Mendis spins one back in as Morgan shuffles back onto his stumps, he's hit on the pad to spark a huge appeal and Billy raises one crooked finger to send the batsman on his way. Another very valuable wicket for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

dismissalComment.html: devious delivery. Slower ball on a full length, and Kieswetter is hoodwinked completely. A leading edge loops to mid-on, and that's the end of that

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: ...and strikes with the first ball! Yorker swerves in, finds the inside-edge that cannons off the pad onto the stumps. Dot ball too. Pretty decent effort from Bresnan again, without his fifty stand with Cook England would be in even worse shape

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot

dismissalComment.html: devious delivery. Slower ball on a full length, and Kieswetter is hoodwinked completely. A leading edge loops to mid-on, and that's the end of that

dismissalText.commentary: Jonathan Trott c Dilshan b Lakmal 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: oh dear, that's the end of that. Driven loosely, and in the air, possibly over-anxious about getting his run-rate moving. And that's scooped easily to mid-off

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Morgan b Dernbach 79 (77b 9x4 0x6 106m) SR: 102.59

dismissalComment.html: wide long-hop  works the trick for Dernbach! He celebrates wildly but Jayawardene has given him this one. It was very wide and the drive was sliced straight to Morgan at point. Ends a wonderful innings from Jayawardene

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

dismissalComment.html: a chipped drive flies towards short extra cover, where Eoin Morgan leaps to pluck the ball out of the air. There's the breakthrough! It's come against the run of play, and it may well be too late for England to change the course of this game, but Swann has given them some hope. Chandimal remains, however, and is looking really good
beaten by one that doesn't turn! Kandamby's bat was hanging outside the line, the ball struck his front pad in line with the stumps and Nigel Llong raised his finger to send him on his way

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: TM Dilshan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'im! Bresnan knocks back the off stump with a perfect length delivery that beats a loose defensive push. That was a great delivery, Dilshan's feet went nowhere and subtle movement took the ball past the bat

It's come against the run of play, and it may well be too late for England to change the course of this game, but Swann has given them some hope. Chandimal remains, however, and is looking really good

headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: BMAJ Mendis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: BMAJ Mendis headshot

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Chandimal gets down on one knee and slices Anderson over cover for four to end the match!

commentPostTextItems.html: Sri Lanka move into a 2-1 series lead with a six-wicket win. A slightly bizarre finish at the end, but Chandimal did the job for his team, and thumps the badge over his heart as he walks off to a standing ovation. One always felt that England's 246 wouldn't be quite enough on a belter of a pitch, and Chandimal answered Cook's ton with a century of his own to take his team home. It'll be interesting to hear what Dilshan has to say at the presentation, stick with us for that.

"I am a SL fan, but that was the most disgraceful display of selfishness by Chandimal.  Somebody needs to teach him :Country before self" Quite right Vis8, but a century at Lord's for a 21-year-old is a great moment for him.

Sanjiv: "@vis8 - Personally I dont think this is Chandimals fault at all. Angelo was defending every ball and was the senior man in the partnership. Also, Chandimal nearly got run out when he wanted a single and Angelo didnt so that clearly shows that Chandimal wanted things to move on." This issue is really splitting our feedbackers.
Match referee Alan Hurst, who will bow out at the end of this series, gets a special medal to commemorate his 100th match to start things off.

"We need to bounce back," a disappointed Alastair Cook says to Athers. "We kept losing wickets at the wrong time, we always seemed to be rebuilding. It's always nice to score runs, but disappointing to do it in a losing cause. There are a lot of areas we can improve on. We have to keep striving to take wickets on flatter wickets, these things don't change overnight and need hard work."

"We won comfortably in the end," says a smiling Tillakaratne Dilshan. "I was a little tense at the end, but they are youngsters, they are learning, and I'm happy with them," he says of Mathews and Chandimal's partnership. "This wicket was really flat, a 280-290 wicket. The important thing for Chandimal was that he won the game for us. We are very confident after the last two games, and looking forward to winning the series."
"I did well because I just played my normal game," says Man of the Match Dinesh Chandimal. "I thank my captain and team-mates for their support."

That's all from your commentary team. Thanks for joining us, and before you go we've got a plethora of post-match awesomeness for you to digest, including Andrew Miller's bulletin, Andrew McGlashan's Play's of the Day and a whopping great gallery. Join us on Wednesday for the fourth match of the series at Trent Bridge, where the first ball should be bowled at 1.30pm BST. Goodbye!

commentTextItems.html: full on off stump, punched to cover
full and straight, driven very hard but straight to mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a full toss is tapped back to the bowler
pushed to leg, no single to be had
dug out into the leg side for a single

commentPostTextItems.html: Actually, I must point out that there were plenty of smiles and clapping on the balcony, although Dilshan wasn't smiling just yet

commentTextItems.html: finally! There's the hundred, Chandimal smashing the ball over wide long-on! Sri Lanka's fans are delirious with joy, as is Chandimal - who gets a big hug from a relieved Mathews - but there are some stony faces on the Sri Lanka balcony
Chandimal gives himself acres of room and digs out a yorker to point

commentPostTextItems.html: No runs off the last nine deliveries!

commentTextItems.html: a maiden! Full toss on off stump and Mathews just taps it gently back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: 12th man sprints on with gloves, a drink and a strongly-worded message! Umpire Nigel Llong swiftly sends him from the field, and all sorts of England players are having a go at the batsmen now, KP leading the way.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: what is going on out there? Mathews glances out to fine leg, and says no to the single! Dilshan is standing up and shouting from the balcony, he really isn't happy!
ha, left alone!
very full on off stump, dug out back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: 12th man is on the boundary waving a pair of gloves about, he's obviously been given a message to deliver!

commentTextItems.html: full on off stump, defended to mid-onA

commentPostTextItems.html: All sorts of people shouting down from Sri Lanka's balcony, they just want them to seal the game!

commentTextItems.html: past the outside edge! There didn't seem anything too special about the delivery, it was just on a good length outside off and he pushed inside it
another attempted paddle, this time it fizzes right past him. And Mathews will have the strike in the next over!

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a low full toss is dug out to mid-off
Chandimal attempts the Dilscoop and gets a faint touch on it, Kieswetter leaps but can't stop it and they sprint through for two

commentPostTextItems.html: "I would laugh my head off, if SL some how end up losing this game now..." says Amir. Indeed, they ought to get on with it.

commentTextItems.html: nudged through square leg, another single
full toss, Chandimal tries to go down the ground but doesn't come close to timing it. This time the single is taken

commentPostTextItems.html: Chandimal is getting an earful from KP now, and neither Law nor Dilshan seem too happy with the tactics. Just win the game!

commentPreTextItems.html: And the Batting Powerplay is taken. Bresnan will bowl. Chandimal has 91.

commentTextItems.html: great yorker, Chandimal digs it out to square leg ... and turns down the run!

commentPostTextItems.html: Dilshan is scowling at him from the balcony, he doesn't like this

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Mendis spins one back in as Morgan shuffles back onto his stumps, he's hit on the pad to spark a huge appeal and Billy raises one crooked finger to send the batsman on his way. Another very valuable wicket for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook run out (†Sangakkara) 119 (143b 13x4 0x6 208m) SR: 83.21

dismissalComment.html: Cook falls trying to steal a bye. Sangakkara hit the stumps with his under-arm flick and it ends a very important innings for Cook. He gets a standing ovation and rightly so, he may not have been swift but England's other batsmen didn't allow him to be

headshotImage.caption: EJG Morgan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: EJG Morgan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Morgan b Dernbach 79 (77b 9x4 0x6 106m) SR: 102.59

dismissalComment.html: wide long-hop  works the trick for Dernbach! He celebrates wildly but Jayawardene has given him this one. It was very wide and the drive was sliced straight to Morgan at point. Ends a wonderful innings from Jayawardene

headshotImage.caption: TM Dilshan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Bresnan 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'im! Bresnan knocks back the off stump with a perfect length delivery that beats a loose defensive push. That was a great delivery, Dilshan's feet went nowhere and subtle movement took the ball past the bat

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal not out 105 (126b 11x4 2x6 196m) SR: 83.33

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: EJG Morgan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: EJG Morgan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Morgan b Swann 25 (47b 2x4 0x6 58m) SR: 53.19

dismissalComment.html: a chipped drive flies towards short extra cover, where Eoin Morgan leaps to pluck the ball out of the air. There's the breakthrough! It's come against the run of play, and it may well be too late for England to change the course of this game, but Swann has given them some hope. Chandimal remains, however, and is looking really good

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thilina Kandamby lbw b Swann 11 (13b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 84.61

dismissalComment.html: beaten by one that doesn't turn! Kandamby's bat was hanging outside the line, the ball struck his front pad in line with the stumps and Nigel Llong raised his finger to send him on his way

notes: England innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 32 runs, 2 wickets)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 32 runs, 0 wicket)
England: 50 runs in 13.2 overs (80 balls), Extras 1
Drinks: England - 65/2 in 16.0 overs (AN Cook 27, KP Pietersen 32)
England: 100 runs in 24.4 overs (148 balls), Extras 5
AN Cook: 50 off 69 balls (8 x 4)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 60 balls (AN Cook 27, IR Bell 19, Ex 4)
Powerplay 3: Overs 34.1 - 39.0 (Batting side - 24 runs, 1 wicket)
Drinks: England - 149/4 in 35.0 overs (AN Cook 66, IR Bell 27)
England: 150 runs in 35.3 overs (213 balls), Extras 6
England: 200 runs in 43.3 overs (261 balls), Extras 6
AN Cook: 100 off 127 balls (11 x 4)
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 49 balls (AN Cook 31, TT Bresnan 19, Ex 0)
Innings Break: England - 246/7 in 50.0 overs (SCJ Broad 1, GP Swann 11)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 61 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 8.4 overs (52 balls), Extras 1
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (DPMD Jayawardene 29, LD Chandimal 19, Ex 2)
Powerplay 2: Overs 12.1 - 17.0 (Bowling side - 28 runs, 0 wicket)
DPMD Jayawardene: 50 off 45 balls (7 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 16.1 overs (97 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 101/1 in 17.0 overs (DPMD Jayawardene 58, LD Chandimal 35)
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 97 balls (DPMD Jayawardene 55, LD Chandimal 39, Ex 6)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 27.2 overs (164 balls), Extras 13
LD Chandimal: 50 off 73 balls (6 x 4)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 168/2 in 31.0 overs (LD Chandimal 50, KC Sangakkara 17)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 63 balls (LD Chandimal 16, KC Sangakkara 18, Ex 16)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 37.6 overs (228 balls), Extras 25
Powerplay 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0 (Batting side - 15 runs, 0 wicket)
LD Chandimal: 100 off 123 balls (10 x 4, 2 x 6)

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka in England, 2011
stories.subTitle: Third ODI
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, England v Sri Lanka in England, 2011

stories.title: Chandimal earned his stripes
stories.seoTitle: Mahela Jayawardene: Chandimal earned his stripes
stories.summary: Maybe the go-slow at the end was not exactly ideal, but Dinesh Chandimal showed he could take whatever England dished out

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal was made to hop as England moved to a short-pitched attack
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal was made to hop as England moved to a short-pitched attack, England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's July 3 2011

stories.title: Dilshan disapproves of century go-slow
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: Dilshan disapproves of century go-slow
stories.summary: Sri Lanka's captain Tillakaratne Dilshan admitted he was 'disappointed' with how his team crossed the winning line at Lord's

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal celebrates the moment he struck the winning runs
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal celebrates the moment he struck the winning runs, England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's July 3 2011

stories.title: Cook answers his critics, and opens a can of worms
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: Cook answers his critics, and opens a can of worms
stories.summary: His first one-day century as captain but another defeat for his team left Alastair Cook with a day of mixed emotions and plenty of questions

image.caption: Alastair Cook brings up his second ODI century, and his first as captain
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook brings up his second ODI century, and his first as captain, England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's July 3 2011

stories.title: KP's new hoodoo and England's missing tempo
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: KP's new hoodoo and England's missing tempo
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the 3rd ODI between England and Sri Lanka at Lord's

image.caption: Stuart Broad faces up to another wicketless spell
image.longCaption: Stuart Broad faces up to another wicketless spell, England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's July 3 2011

stories.title: Chandimal century seals crushing victory
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's: Chandimal century seals crushing victory
stories.summary: In the end, victory was sealed with six wickets and ten balls to spare, but Chandimal's quest for a maiden Lord's century - which he sealed with a cathartic six over long-on in the 48th over, after Mathews had played out a maiden at the other end - left m

image.caption: Dinesh Chandimal struck two sixes and 11 fours in his 105
image.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal struck two sixes and 11 fours in his 105, England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's July 3 2011

stories.title: Dealing with spin is key says Morgan
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Lord's
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: Dealing with spin is key says Eoin Morgan
stories.summary: Eoin Morgan says improving England's performances against spin in one-day cricket is key to them improving their consistency

image.caption: Eoin Morgan made a 37-ball half-century to lift England's tempo
